title: 15. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: When to Harvest (19 April 2012)

** Checking grain hardness

** Considering weather conditions and soil moisture for irrigation decisions

** Operating the moisture meter to obtain readings
** Averaging multiple samples for a more accurate moisture content assessment
** Ensuring soil is suitable for combine harvesting (adequate drying)
** Considering the impact of soil type (e.g., heavy clay) on equipment performance
** Checking current weather conditions (hot and dry)
** Predicting future weather patterns (hoping for light rain)
** Factoring weather forecasts into harvest timing
** Estimating time until harvest (10-14 days)
** Scheduling harvest date (aiming for May 2nd)
** Preparing for combine harvesting at the optimal time
** Adapting practices based on previous experiences and evolutions in cultivation methods
** Prioritizing the best approach for soil moisture management and crop health
